entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs parliamentary opposition holds Karabakh rally in Yerevan

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs parliamentary opposition holds Karabakh rally in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
üìçAs of March 2022, Armenia‚Äôs inflation rate was registered at 7.4%, according to the country‚Äôs Statistical Committee. üìçBetween January-February 2022, 5,344 children were born and 6,030 people died in the country. üìçThe parliamentary oppositional blocs - Armenia Alliance and I Have Honor - held a joint rally in Yerevan‚Äôs Freedom Square.

entry.title: Amputated during the Karabakh War, Sargis continues to live life to the fullest

media:group.media:title: Amputated during the Karabakh War, Sargis continues to live life to the fullest
media:group.media:description:
Sargis Harutyunyan was serving in the army when the Karabakh War broke out in September 2020. On the 30th day of the war, Sargis lost his legs when a shell struck him. Despite the difficulties, he continues to live life to the fullest.
Photos credit: Dmitry Belyakov

entry.title: Tackling the new demand for jobs in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Tackling the new demand for jobs in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Luiza Avetisyan is the co-founder of Staff.am, an online portal which assists job seekers find work in Armenia. In a conversation with CivilNet, Luiza discusses the influx of young Russian professionals into Armenia and how the Staff.am team is helping them find employment. Luiza also explains which sectors of the economy are growing exponentially, how more jobs can be created outside of Yerevan, and what long term effects this influx will have for Armenia‚Äôs economy.
